documents.content: The claims audit for Q3 highlighted an increase in prior authorization requests for biologics at Mountain View Regional. Dr. Elara Koshy noted a 28% rise in rheumatology referrals, particularly for psoriatic arthritis patients. The audit flagged Policy #BIOL-441 revisions requiring step therapy attempts before biologic approvals. Systems memo attached shows data integration gaps between Epic and the regional provider network portal.

Patient 88742-LZW (DOB 04/15/1987) presented with persistent dactylitis and nail pitting at Banner Arthritis Center. Initial treatment plan included methotrexate + prednisone taper. Prior auth submitted for TNF inhibitor under exception criteria per Policy #BIOL-441. Provider phone: 602-555-0187. Next follow-up scheduled 12 weeks post-treatment initiation.

Mountain View Rheumatology quarterly review shows 62% of psoriatic arthritis patients required therapy adjustments within first 3 months. Research collaboration with Banner initiated to track outcomes of Policy #BIOL-441 implementation. Study ID: ARTH-339. Contact research coordinator at rcoordinators@bannerarth.edu for participation details.

Patient survey response from 88742-LZW: 'Medication prior authorization process took 11 days, delaying my treatment. Dr. Koshy’s team eventually secured approval for monthly injections.' Address: 4427 Silverado Trail, Fountain Hills, AZ. Survey submitted via portal on 10/22/2023.

Phoenix Healthcare Journal reports Mountain View Regional testing new prior authorization AI platform targeting rheumatology claims. Pilot reduced decision time by 40% for Policy #BIOL-441 cases. Implementation challenges include EHR mapping discrepancies and staff training needs. Full rollout expected Q2 2024.
